sections.text:
15-105.Corporate limits; extension; contiguous territory, defined.

For purposes of sections 15-104 to 15-106.02, land shall be deemed contiguous although a stream, embankments, or a strip or parcel of land, not more than five hundred feet wide, lies between such land and the corporate limits.

SourceLaws 1901, c. 16, § 5, p. 72;R.S.1913, § 4408;C.S.1922, § 3784;C.S.1929, § 15-105;R.S.1943, § 15-105;Laws 1972, LB 1147, § 1;Laws 2020, LB1003, § 8.
